summary: White snakeroot is a common name for several flowering plants in the aster family, Asteraceae, and may refer to:  Ageratina altissima, native to eastern North America (older name: Eupatorium rugosum) Ayapana triplinervis, native to the tropical Americas

flower.description: Head flowers 7-8 mm in diameter, 15-25 regular flowers. Involucre cylindrical, 4-5.5 mm long, involucral segment arranged in 1 row, narrow oblong shape, hairs on dorsal side. 5 rows at the end of normalization, style of stigma, 2 core rows, exposed outside the corolla.

shape.stem: Short rhizome, hairs only on top of stem. The plant itself tends to lignify.
shape.leaf: Ovoid, 2-10 cm long, 1.5-6 cm wide. Stem apex, acute or circular, leaf edge rough acute, petiole 2-6 cm long.
shape.fruit: Achenes 2 mm long, 4-5 angular, black, glossy.

habitat.overseas: around the forest, on the roadside
